lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Shiho.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Shiho.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
// Update the title above to match the actual product name
// Describe the action and its outcome.
// A description of the expected outcome goes here
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {
* Returns a string (to be encoded by Shiho.run()) depending on the user input
* @param userInput The input entered into the chatbot by the user
* @return String representing the type of user input
// returns a specific String depending on userInput and handles it in Shiho
// bye command ends the current instance
// list command displays current list of tasks
// mark command marks a specific task as done
// unmark command marks a specific task as undone
// delete command removes a specific task from the list
// todo, deadline and event commands indicate specific types of tasks to be added to the list
* Returns a Task object that the file line represents.
* @param line The current line in the text file being parsed.
* @return Task object represented by the line.
Task task = new Event(parts[2], eventFrom, eventTo);
* Runs the Shiho chatbot and handles inputs depending on return value of the Parser.
// initially assume input is valid (isValid only applies for todo/deadline/event commands)
ui.show("\n"); // adds a newline if it's the last element of the list
ui.show("Okay. I've marked this task as done:\n"
ui.show("Okay. I've marked this task as not done yet:\n"
ui.show("Noted. I've removed this task:\n   " + removed.toString());
ui.show("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.\n");
ui.show("Wrong input syntax. Correct syntax is 'todo (task name)'.\n");
/* given the command deadline finish homework /by 2026-01-25 2000:
ui.show("Wrong input syntax. Correct syntax is 'deadline (task name) /by (deadline)'.\n"
+ "Times should be in 24-hour format i.e XXXX.\n"
/* given the command event family dinner /from 2026-01-25 6pm /to 2026-01-25 7pm:
ui.show("Wrong input syntax. Correct syntax is 'event (task name) /from (start) /to (end)'.\n"
+ "Format for both start and end is 'YYYY-MM-DD time'.\n"
+ "Times should be in 24-hour format i.e XXXX.\n"
ui.show("Your input is either empty or not recognised. Please try again.\n");
// only increments and adds to task list if task command is valid
ui.show("\n" + "Got it. I've added this task: " + tasks.get(tasks.size() - 1).toString() + "\n");
ui.show("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.\n");
* Executes the run method at the specific file path.
* Loads tasks from the storage file. Creates the file if it does not exist.
* @return An ArrayList of tasks stored in the given file path.
* @throws IOException If an error occurs while creating or loading the file.
// loads the existing task list from the file path, and creates a new one if it doesn't exist
// if the directory and file does not exist yet, creates it
* Saves tasks stored in the storage file.
* @throws IOException If an error occurs while saving the file.
public void save(ArrayList<Task> tasks) throws IOException {
* Returns a string representing the status icon ("X" or blank) of a task.
* @return Status icon representing whether the task is done or not.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Toggles the isDone boolean of the task to true.
* Toggles the isDone boolean of the task to false.
* Returns the string representation of the task, including its status icon and description.
* Returns the string representation of the task to be stored in a task list file, including '|' separators.
* @return String representation of task to be stored in a file.
* Adds the specified task to the task list.
* Returns the task at the specified index in the task list.
* @param index Index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The task at the corresponding index.
* Removes the task at the specified index in the task list.
* @param index Index of the task to remove.
* Returns a boolean representing whether the task list is empty.
* @return Boolean indicating whether task list is empty.
* Returns the size of the current task list.
* @return The size of the current task list, as an integer.
* Returns the current task list as an ArrayList.
* @return The current task list, represented as an ArrayList.
* Returns the command given by the user.
* Prints the specified message out to the system.
* @param msg Message string to be printed out.
* Prints out a specific error message when no existing task list is detected by the chatbot.
System.out.println("No existing task list found in storage. Creating empty task list.");
Task targetTask = parser.parseFileLine("D | 0 | buy milk at the store | 2026-01-27 2200");
assertEquals("buy milk at the store", targetTask.description);
